thread.title: Quirk named Cannons coach
thread.title_full: Quirk named Cannons coach | Boston Herald

author: Bruce Lerch
title: Quirk named Cannons coach
text:
The Boston Cannons will have new leadership for the 2016 season, with Sean Quirk taking over as coach and Ian Frenette as president.
The team will announced the hirings today.
“I’m really excited about the opportunity, no doubt about it,” Quirk, the longtime coach at Endicott College, said yesterday. “I’ve been coaching for a long time, I’ve played the game for a long time and this is just a great opportunity that’s come along and I’m looking forward to looking with (general manager) Kevin (Barney) and the organization and a great group of players that we have coming back.”
Quirk won 243 games in 18 years at Endicott before stepping down after last season. He led the Gulls to eight Commonwealth Coast Conference titles and nine NCAA tournament appearances. Quirk will remain at the school as an associate athletic director.
As a player, Quirk was a two-time All-American goalie at Springfield College and helped lead the Pride to an NCAA Division 2 championship in 1994.
Quirk replaces John Tucker, the MLL Coach of the Year last season after leading the Cannons back to the postseason after a two-year drought. Tucker left during the offseason to become the coach and general manager of the expansion Atlanta Blaze.
While the Cannons interviewed candidates from across the country, bringing in a coach with New England roots was a big factor in the decision.
“He’s very dedicated and loyal and after speaking with him, we knew that he was the right person to keep the same focus and mentality of what we’ve built built for the last two years,” Barney said. “We also knew he was very entrenched in the lacrosse community of New England and could be that ambassador and face of the team in the community as well. At the end of the day it was an easy decision and we’re confident that he’s going to help continue our team in that direction towards bringing back the championship.”
Frenette also has New England ties, having spent the last six years as the Celtics’ vice president of corporate sponsorships.
In related news, the Cannons today will release their 12-man protected list for next month’s expansion draft.
